message.content: 測試exa mcp工具是否成功調用，上網搜尋python的最新版本

content.text:
我會使用 exa MCP 工具來測試是否能成功搜尋 Python 的最新版本資訊。

`★ 洞察 ─────────────────────────────────────`
• 使用 Exa AI 進行網路搜尋可以獲得即時、準確的資訊
• Python 版本更新資訊通常可在官方網站或技術文檔中找到
• 測試 MCP 工具的連接性是確保工具鏈正常運作的重要步驟
`─────────────────────────────────────────────────`

      "id": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_Python",
      "title": "History of Python",
      "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_Python",
      "publishedDate": "2025-08-14T01:47:03.000Z",

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

History of the Python programming language

| |
| --- |
| This article **is missing information** about prominent features of versions after 3.0. Please expand the article to include this information. Further details may exist on the [talk page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:History_of_Python)._(March 2024)_ |

Old Python logo, 1990s–2006New Python logo, 2006–presentGuido van Rossum in 2014

The [programming language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Programming_language) [Python](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Python_(programming_language)) was conceived in the late 1980s,[\[1\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-venners-interview-pt-1-1) and its implementation was started in December 1989[\[2\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-timeline-of-python-2) by [Guido van Rossum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guido_van_Rossum) at [CWI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrum_Wiskunde_%26_Informatica) in [the Netherlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Netherlands) as a successor to [ABC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABC_(programming_language)) capable of [exception handling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exception_handling) and interfacing with the [Amoeba operating system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amoeba_(operating_system)).[\[3\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-faq-created-3) Van Rossum was Python's principal author and had a central role in deciding the direction of Python (as reflected in the title given to him by the Python community, [_Benevolent Dictator for Life_ (BDFL)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benevolent_dictator_for_life)[\[4\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-5)) until stepping down as leader on July 12, 2018.[\[6\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-6) Python was named after the [BBC TV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBC_TV) show _[Monty Python's Flying Circus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Python%27s_Flying_Circus)_.[\[7\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-7)

Python 2.0 was released on October 16, 2000, with many major new features, such as [list comprehensions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_comprehension), [cycle-detecting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cycle_detection) [garbage collector](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garbage_collection_(computer_science)), [reference counting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reference_counting), [memory management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memory_management) and support for [Unicode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode), along with a change to the development process itself, with a shift to a more transparent and community-backed process.[\[8\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-newin-2.0-8)

Python 3.0, a major, backwards-incompatible release, was released on December 3,",
      "image": "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Guido-portrait-2014.jpg/960px-Guido-portrait-2014.jpg",
      "favicon": "https://en.wikipedia.org/static/apple-touch/wikipedia.png"
    },
    {
      "id": "https://www.liquidweb.com/blog/latest-python-version/",
      "title": "The latest Python version: Python 3.13.3",
      "url": "https://www.liquidweb.com/blog/latest-python-version/",
      "publishedDate": "2025-04-10T18:30:46.000Z",
      "author": "Liquid Web",
      "text": "Python continues to evolve, bringing powerful new features, enhanced security, and performance improvements with every release.

The latest major version, **Python 3.13** was officially released on October 7, 2024.

Let’s explore the key features of Python’s current version, how to download and install it, and what this release means for developers.

## What’s the latest Python version?

**The latest stable version of Python is 3.13.3**

Python 3.13.3 was released on April 8, 2025 with several improvements:

- **Enhanced interactive interpreter** adds multi-line editing and syntax highlighting for a better coding experience.
- **Experimental free-threaded mode (no GIL)** enables true multi-threading support for improved performance.
- **Just-in-time (JIT) compiler** is a new implementation that can boost execution speeds.
- **Colorized tracebacks** improve debugging with color-coded error messages.
- **Performance optimizations** to improve dictionary operations, memory management, and list and string handling.

## Key features of the latest Python release

Python 3.13.3 introduces several enhancements that developers can leverage.

- **Interactive interpreter upgrade.** A PyPy-inspired interactive shell now supports multi-line editing, syntax highlighting, and colorized tracebacks—making testing and debugging faster and easier.
- **Zero-GIL free-threaded mode (experimental).** Developers can now run Python without the Global Interpreter Lock, unlocking true multi-core parallelism on supported platforms like Windows and macOS.
- **Just-in-Time (JIT) compiler (preview).** A basic JIT engine lays the groundwork for major speed boosts in future releases. Early tests show notable improvements in execution time.
- **Colorized debugging.** Tracebacks are color-coded: red for errors, yellow/orange for warnings, and green/blue for file paths and source code—visually speeding up problem detection.
- **Performance upgrades.** Memory management is more efficient thanks to mimalloc, dictionary operations are faster, and slicing/searching in strings and lists has been optimized.
- **Better tooling support.** `locals()` has more consistent behavior, helping debugging tools function more reliably.
- **Platform support updates.** Python 3.13.3 improves compatibility for Android and iOS (Tier 3), officially adds WASI (Tier 2), and drops support for Emscripten and macOS < 10.13.
- **Smaller .pyc Files.** Stripped indentation in docstrings means leaner bytecode files and reduced memory usage.
- **New dbm.sqlite3 Backend.** The `dbm` module now defaults to an SQLite-based backend for new files, improving data storage consistency.

## Why is it important to use the current Python version?

Using the latest Python version ensures:

- **Security** to protect your projects from vulnerabilities and [cybersecurity risks](https://www.liquidweb.com/blog/cybersecurity-predictions/).
- **Performance** to make coding faster and more efficient.
- **Access to new features** to e",

The latest major version, **Python 3.13** was officially released on October 7, 2024.

Let’s explore the key features of Python’s current version, how to download and install it, and what this release means for developers.

## What’s the latest Python version?

Python 3.13.3 was released on April 8, 2025 with several improvements:

- **Enhanced interactive interpreter** adds multi-line editing and syntax highlighting for a better coding experience.
- **Experimental free-threaded mode (no GIL)** enables true multi-threading support for improved performance.
- **Just-in-time (JIT) compiler** is a new implementation that can boost execution speeds.
- **Colorized tracebacks** improve debugging with color-coded error messages.

## Key features of the latest Python release

Python 3.13.3 introduces several enhancements that developers can leverage.

- **Interactive interpreter upgrade.** A PyPy-inspired interactive shell now supports multi-line editing, syntax highlighting, and colorized tracebacks—making testing and debugging faster and easier.
- **Zero-GIL free-threaded mode (experimental).** Developers can now run Python without the Global Interpreter Lock, unlocking true multi-core parallelism on supported platforms like Windows and macOS.
- **Just-in-Time (JIT) compiler (preview).** A basic JIT engine lays the groundwork for major speed boosts in future releases. Early tests show notable improvements in execution time.
- **Colorized debugging.** Tracebacks are color-coded: red for errors, yellow/orange for warnings, and green/blue for file paths and source code—visually speeding up problem detection.
- **Performance upgrades.** Memory management is more efficient thanks to mimalloc, dictionary operations are faster, and slicing/searching in strings and lists has been optimized.
- **Better tooling support.** `locals()` has more consistent behavior, helping debugging tools function more reliably.
- **Platform support updates.** Python 3.13.3 improves compatibility for Android and iOS (Tier 3), officially adds WASI (Tier 2), and drops support for Emscripten and macOS < 10.13.
- **Smaller .pyc Files.** Stripped indentation in docstrings means leaner bytecode files and reduced memory usage.
- **New dbm.sqlite3 Backend.** The `dbm` module now defaults to an SQLite-based backend for new files, improving data storage consistency.

## Why is it important to use the current Python version?

Using the latest Python version ensures:

- **Security** to protect your projects from vulnerabilities and [cybersecurity risks](https://www.liquidweb.com/blog/cybersecurity-predictions/).
- **Performance** to make coding faster and more efficient.

content.text:
太好了！exa MCP 工具成功運作！我成功搜尋到了 Python 的最新版本資訊。

`★ 洞察 ─────────────────────────────────────`
• Exa AI 搜尋工具成功連接並返回了豐富的即時資訊
• 搜尋結果包含官方來源和第三方技術網站的綜合資料
• 工具能夠自動解析並提供結構化的搜尋結果和成本資訊
`─────────────────────────────────────────────────`

## 搜尋結果摘要

**Python 最新穩定版本：Python 3.13.7**
- 發布日期：2025年8月14日（19天前）
- 目前狀態：積極維護中

### 主要版本資訊

1. **Python 3.13 系列**（最新主要版本）
   - 首次正式發布：2024年10月7日
   - 最新修補版本：3.13.7（2025年8月14日）
   - 支援期限：2029年10月

2. **主要新功能**
   - 增強的互動式解釋器（多行編輯、語法高亮）
   - 實驗性無 GIL 自由線程模式
   - 即時編譯器（JIT）預覽版
   - 彩色化的錯誤追蹤
   - 效能優化（記憶體管理、字典操作）

3. **其他活躍版本**
   - Python 3.12.11（安全維護模式）
   - Python 3.11.13（安全維護模式）
   - Python 3.10.18（安全維護模式）

### 搜尋工具效能
- 搜尋時間：4.53 秒
- 成本：$0.01 USD
- 返回結果：5個高品質來源

exa MCP 工具測試成功！它能夠準確地搜尋並返回最新的 Python 版本資訊。
